meanings.definition: The state or quality of being long in distance or time.
meanings.sent1: The longnesses of the journey seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent2: The longnesses of the river made it difficult to cross.
meanings.sent3: The longnesses of the line at the amusement park tested our patience.
meanings.sent4: The longnesses of the winter felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The longnesses of the hallway made it feel like a never-ending maze.

meanings.definition: The extent of something from end to end.
meanings.sent1: The longnesses of the table allowed for many guests to sit.
meanings.sent2: The longnesses of the bridge spanned the entire river.
meanings.sent3: The longnesses of the scarf made it perfect for the cold weather.
meanings.sent4: The longnesses of the road seemed to stretch on forever.
meanings.sent5: The longnesses of the bookshelf accommodated all the books.

meanings.sent1: The longnesses of the movie made it hard to stay awake.

meanings.sent3: The longnesses of the wait for the food was unbearable.
meanings.sent4: The longnesses of the lecture felt like hours.
meanings.sent5: The longnesses of the vacation flew by too quickly.
